Package org.team2.cluk.backend.webresources

Class Restaurant

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.team2.cluk.backend.webresources.Restaurant
  • @Path("/restaurant")
public class Restaurant
extends java.lang.Object
    Restaurant Class which handles stocks information, ordering stock and recieving orders, creating meals and checking prices
    Version:
    11/05/2019

      Compares two dates and selects the latest.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response createMeal​(java.lang.String idToken, java.lang.String restaurantAddress, java.lang.String meal)
      This method creates a meal within a restaurant Users are required to input the item and the quantity needed to create the meal The system will check whether the quantity of the item is below the minimum stock.
      java.lang.String enforceDayLimit​(java.lang.String restaurantAddress)
      Ensure restaurant hasn't had order in last 3 days.

      method that gets the minimum stock
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response getPrice​(java.lang.String idToken, java.lang.String meal)
      Method to get the price of a meal item within a restaurant If successful, system will show "Item: " + meal + " Cost: " + price"
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response getRestaurantList​(java.lang.String idToken)
      method to get a list of the restaurants
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response getTodaysOrders​(java.lang.String idToken, java.lang.String restaurantAddress)
      method to get today's deliveries.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response getTotalStock​(java.lang.String idToken, java.lang.String restaurantAddress)
      Method which handles request for total stock units at a given restaurant given as "address" in the request header The system will ask users to input a restaurant's address The system will show information about the total stock in the given restaurant If the restaurant address is blank, the system will show "ADDRESS_BLANK_OR_NOT_PROVIDED" If method is successful, the system will show items that are stocked in the restaurant the quantity of the item
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response minStockCheck​(java.lang.String idToken, java.lang.String restaurantAddress)
      This method is used to check whether the stock at restaurant is above the minimum stock level Users are required to input the restaurant's address If there is an item of stock below the minimum, the system will show "Current stock of "+ stockItem +" at "+ restaurantAddress + " is below minimum stock levels by "+deficit+"."
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response receiveOrder​(java.lang.String idToken, java.lang.String restaurantAddress, int orderId)
      This method updates the stock for a restaurant when it has received an order If it is unsuccessful, the system will show "ORDER_NOT_FOUND" If successful, the system will show "ORDER_RECEIVED" and add the information to the restaurant stock Users must choose the item and quantity that the restaurant has ordered and the address of the restaurant
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response requestCustomOrder​(java.lang.String idToken, java.lang.String restaurantAddress, java.lang.String customOrderStr, java.lang.String strOrderContents)
      method executed when client requests custom order at the endpoint "/restaurant/request-order/custom" orders include any quantity of stock.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response requestStandardOrder​(java.lang.String idToken, java.lang.String restaurantAddress)
      Method requests standard order for a restaurant.
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response updateMinStock​(java.lang.String idToken, java.lang.String restaurantAddress, java.lang.String strStockObject)
      This method is used to allow the minimum stock level to be changed Users need to choose the item which is required to change and input the quantity they would like to update it to If successful, the system will state "Minimum stock levels updated to: " + min If unsuccessful, the system will state "SQL exception occurred when closing SQL statement"
      javax.ws.rs.core.Response updateStock​(java.lang.String idToken, java.lang.String address, java.lang.String requestBody)
      Method to update the restaurant stock allowing for manual adjustment of stock levels If successsful, system shows "STOCK_UPDATED" If unsuccessful, system shows "ERROR_UPDATING_STOCK"

    • Method Detail

      • getTotalStock

        @GET
@Path("/get-total-stock")
@Produces("application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getTotalStock​(@HeaderParam("Authorization")
                                               java.lang.String idToken,
                                               @HeaderParam("address")
                                               java.lang.String restaurantAddress)
        Method which handles request for total stock units at a given restaurant given as "address" in the request header The system will ask users to input a restaurant's address The system will show information about the total stock in the given restaurant If the restaurant address is blank, the system will show "ADDRESS_BLANK_OR_NOT_PROVIDED" If method is successful, the system will show items that are stocked in the restaurant the quantity of the item
        Parameters:
        idToken - to check access for restaurant
        restaurantAddress - address of the restaurant provided in the request header as "address"
        Returns:
        JSON array with all stock stored in that restaurant

      • receiveOrder

        @GET
@Path("/receive-order")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response receiveOrder​(@HeaderParam("idToken")
                                              java.lang.String idToken,
                                              @HeaderParam("address")
                                              java.lang.String restaurantAddress,
                                              @HeaderParam("order-id")
                                              int orderId)
        This method updates the stock for a restaurant when it has received an order If it is unsuccessful, the system will show "ORDER_NOT_FOUND" If successful, the system will show "ORDER_RECEIVED" and add the information to the restaurant stock Users must choose the item and quantity that the restaurant has ordered and the address of the restaurant
        Parameters:
        idToken - to check access for restaurant
        restaurantAddress - address of the restaurant provided in the request header as "address"
        orderId - of the stock recieved by the restaurant
        Returns:
        order added to restaurant stock

      • requestCustomOrder

        @Path("/request-order/custom")
@POST
@Consumes("application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response requestCustomOrder​(@HeaderParam("Authorization")
                                                    java.lang.String idToken,
                                                    @HeaderParam("address")
                                                    java.lang.String restaurantAddress,
                                                    @HeaderParam("custom")
                                                    java.lang.String customOrderStr,
                                                    java.lang.String strOrderContents)
        method executed when client requests custom order at the endpoint "/restaurant/request-order/custom" orders include any quantity of stock. Stock contents are passed as parameters body of the request should be JSON array with each entry of form: {stockItem: string, quantity: number} If unsuccessful, the system will show "Order entry misspecified. Skipping this entry" If successful, the system will show "ORDER_ACCEPTED"
        Parameters:
        idToken - to check access for restaurant
        restaurantAddress - value of address header specifying restaurant where order shall be delivered
        customOrderStr - "true" if order is a custom order
        strOrderContents - stringified JSON array containing order details
        Returns:
        202 ORDER_ACCEPTED - even if order contains entries not following the specification, they are removed from the order

      • requestStandardOrder

        @Path("/request-order")
@GET
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response requestStandardOrder​(@HeaderParam("Authorization")
                                                      java.lang.String idToken,
                                                      @HeaderParam("address")
                                                      java.lang.String restaurantAddress)
        Method requests standard order for a restaurant. It fetches what the standard order items and quantities are and places the order If successful, the system will select stock item and typical units ordered from stock
        Parameters:
        idToken - to check access for restaurant
        restaurantAddress - address of the destination restaurant, provided in "address" header parameter
        Returns:
        same responses as for requestCustomOrder

      • minStockCheck

        @Path("/min-stock-check")
@GET
@Produces("application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response minStockCheck​(@HeaderParam("Authorization")
                                               java.lang.String idToken,
                                               @HeaderParam("address")
                                               java.lang.String restaurantAddress)
        This method is used to check whether the stock at restaurant is above the minimum stock level Users are required to input the restaurant's address If there is an item of stock below the minimum, the system will show "Current stock of "+ stockItem +" at "+ restaurantAddress + " is below minimum stock levels by "+deficit+"."
        Parameters:
        idToken - to check access for restaurant
        restaurantAddress - address of the restaurant, provided in "address" header parameter
        Returns:
        stock which is under the minimum stock level

      • getMinStock

        @Path("/get-min-stock")
@GET
@Consumes("application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getMinStock​(@HeaderParam("Authorization")
                                             java.lang.String idToken,
                                             @HeaderParam("address")
                                             java.lang.String address)
        method that gets the minimum stock
        Parameters:
        idToken - to check access for restaurant
        address - restaurant address
        Returns:
        JSON array of stock quantity thresholds

      • updateMinStock

        @Path("/update-min-stock")
@POST
@Consumes("application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response updateMinStock​(@HeaderParam("Authorization")
                                                java.lang.String idToken,
                                                @HeaderParam("address")
                                                java.lang.String restaurantAddress,
                                                java.lang.String strStockObject)
        This method is used to allow the minimum stock level to be changed Users need to choose the item which is required to change and input the quantity they would like to update it to If successful, the system will state "Minimum stock levels updated to: " + min If unsuccessful, the system will state "SQL exception occurred when closing SQL statement"
        Parameters:
        idToken - to check access for restaurant
        restaurantAddress - address of the restaurant, provided in "address" header parameter
        strStockObject - stringified JSON array containing minimum stock order details
        Returns:
        the updated stock level

      • createMeal

        @Path("/create-meal")
@GET
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response createMeal​(@HeaderParam("Authorization")
                                            java.lang.String idToken,
                                            @HeaderParam("address")
                                            java.lang.String restaurantAddress,
                                            @HeaderParam("meal")
                                            java.lang.String meal)
        This method creates a meal within a restaurant Users are required to input the item and the quantity needed to create the meal The system will check whether the quantity of the item is below the minimum stock. If the quantity of one item is below the minimum stock, the system will show "STOCK_TOO_LOW" If successful, the system will show "MEAL_CREATED"
        Parameters:
        idToken - to check access for restaurant
        restaurantAddress - address of the restaurant where the meal is created, provided in "address" header parameter
        meal - created from the stock items
        Returns:
        the item that has been created

      • updateStock

        @POST
@Path("/update-stock")
@Consumes("application/json")
@Produces("application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response updateStock​(@HeaderParam("Authorization")
                                             java.lang.String idToken,
                                             @HeaderParam("address")
                                             java.lang.String address,
                                             java.lang.String requestBody)
        Method to update the restaurant stock allowing for manual adjustment of stock levels If successsful, system shows "STOCK_UPDATED" If unsuccessful, system shows "ERROR_UPDATING_STOCK"
        Parameters:
        idToken - to check access for restaurant
        address - address of the restaurant where the stock is updated, provided in "address" header parameter
        requestBody - to request stock
        Returns:
        updated stock

      • getPrice

        @GET
@Path("/get-price")
@Produces("application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getPrice​(@HeaderParam("Authorization")
                                          java.lang.String idToken,
                                          @HeaderParam("meal")
                                          java.lang.String meal)
        Method to get the price of a meal item within a restaurant If successful, system will show "Item: " + meal + " Cost: " + price"
        Parameters:
        idToken - to check access for restaurant
        meal - which has been created previously by the restaurant
        Returns:
        the meal price

@Path("/get-todays-orders")
@Produces("application/json")
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response getTodaysOrders​(@HeaderParam("Authorization")
                                                 java.lang.String idToken,
                                                 @HeaderParam("address")
                                                 java.lang.String restaurantAddress)
        method to get today's deliveries.
        Parameters:
        idToken - ID token assigned on user log in
        restaurantAddress - address of the restaurant
        Returns:
        the orders with delivery date today.
